channel.title: Looping a command

item.title: Looping a command
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:3, topic:237954”][code]
private Timer glowTimer = new Timer(); // make this a field, if it’s a local variable then it will not be able to be accessed from outside the case

glowTimer.scheduleAtFixedRate(new TimerTask() {
public void run() {
stillgfx(247, absY, absX);
}
}, 0, 1000);
[/code] Seems like a good way to do it.
Invoke the timer’s cancel method to stop the glow.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Looping a command
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:9, topic:238009”][quote author=tonypker13 link=topic=314229.msg2499390#msg2499390 date=1224562041]

uuuuuummmmm

boolean modgfx

yea

uum

method

if boolen modglow is true
play the graphic

then!

make a command stating

if command starts with modglow and playerrights is over 1
make modglow boolean true

translate that into java =)

What the hell, nice literature structure!

Lol. He took it off my post XD Look what I posted above him
[/quote]

Not really i was on that post before your post. but you posted then i posted my badly layed out pile of crap.

But yea that thing you posted didn’t work for me.

And why did you start the command with else if?

Also you forgot to make a method closer =o

if (ownerglow == true) {

its more like
public void glows() {
if (adglow == true) { //Admin Glow
stillgfx(197, absY, absX);
}
if (modglow == true) {//PMod Glow
stillgfx(247, absY, absX);
}
if (ownerglow == true) {//Owner Glow
stillgfx(332, absY, absX);
}
}[/quote]
It works. This is what I used before I shut down Rubik’s Scape. Remember the good ol’ days zippeh?

Read full topic

item.title: Looping a command
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

Add the methods.


if (adglow == true) {//Admin Glow
                        stillgfx(197, absY, absX);
			 }
                if (modglow == true) {//PMod Glow
                        stillgfx(247, absY, absX);
                }
                if (ownerglow == true) {//Owner Glow
                        stillgfx(332, absY, absX);
                }

Then your commands.

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("modglow") && playerRights >= 1)
        {
               modglow = true;
        }

        else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("adminglow") && playerRights >= 2)
        {
               adglow = true;
        }

        else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("ownerglow") && playerRights >= 3)
        {
               ownerglow = true;
        }

        else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("modglowoff") && playerRights >= 1)
        {
               modglow =false;
        }

        else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("adminglowoff") && playerRights >= 2)
        {
               adglow = false;
        }

        else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("ownerglowoff") && playerRights >= 3)
        {
               ownerglow = false;
        }

Then your Booleans.

public boolean adglow = false;
public boolean modglow = false;
public boolean ownerglow = false;

Read full topic

item.description:

Ok, how can I loop this so it is continous Dodian base.
